title: What are some epic songs with deep bass? - Quora

response.answer_text: Depends what you need by deep bass I think this bass is pretty deep:(Trentemoller - Vamp)http://grooveshark.com/s/Vamp/3XjmBu?src=5(Asha  - Pantha Du Prince)http://grooveshark.com/s/Asha/1lanv7?src=5 But this one too, in another style: (Herbie Hancock - Chameleon)http://grooveshark.com/s/Chameleon/3ottnq?src=5 Or you just mean what's the best track from the best bassist? (Jaco Pastorius - Elegant People)http://grooveshark.com/s/Elegant+People/2Hx1ha?src=5 Is Funky anything deep?(Basscheck - Slope)http://grooveshark.com/s/Basscheck/4Lf05W?src=5(Blind Man Can See It - James Brown)http://grooveshark.com/s/Blind+Man+Can+See+It/2zgRjj?src=5(Let the drum speak - Bah Samba)http://grooveshark.com/s/Let+The+Drums+Speak+Album+Ver/1xlRc?src=5

Here are some of my favorites. "Gettysburg" by Ratatathttp://grooveshark.com/s/Gettysburg/3gj4mM?src=5 Ratatat would be a good option in general for the type of music (I think) you're asking for. Also, these have lyrics, but are still good:"Solitaire" by The Notwisthttp://grooveshark.com/s/Solitaire/2zIJB8?src=5 "Idioteque" by Radioheadhttp://grooveshark.com/s/Idioteque/2zBNrz?src=5 "The District Sleeps Alone Tonight" by Death Cab for Cutiehttp://grooveshark.com/s/The+District+Sleeps+Alone+Tonight/2q4Kzm?src=5
